texts.text: I watch Izumo head off back home.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well, I should get going too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...You'd better be there, or I'll look really stupid.
Retracing the steps of my memory, I think of the first place Yonagi would go to after coming back to this world.
My mind made up, I head to the only place it could be.
A certain place in the middle side where we used to clean together.
The middle side common area. In that hole we filled up once...
It's open, just as I imagined.
It was just a bunch of rocks we piled together and covered up. Nothing an adult that bothered to look twice could undo.
Even now, we're the only ones who know of this place.
Shachi's dead, after all.
Can I fit now? I'm not as small as I used to be.
I lower to a crouch and squeeze myself through the narrow opening.
There she is.
She's crouching over a little mound in the soil.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*
Wooleep is standing guard by the entrance of the clearing.
This place is a grave for the bird we once took care of.
And Mom's resting place.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.
Yonagi slowly turns around.
And then...
She smiles at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito.
It's her voice.
She's calling my name with a smile on her face.
I come to stand next to her and look over the plant at the very center of the flowerbed.
It's grown quite a bit since we planted it.
Seeing it looking so exuberant brings a smile to my face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The city...
I glance at her profile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's so quiet. It's like there's no one in it.
She's looking up at me now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Did something happen while I was sleeping?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I was sleeping, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Yeah.
She has a quiet, placid smile on her face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I can kind of tell that I've been sleeping for a long, long time.
Yonagi's voice reminds me a lot of Izumo's robotic tone, somehow.
It is like there is barely an inflection in her tone. A distinct lack of emotion.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I also vaguely remember you and Izumo working really hard to wake me up. It's all a little hazy, like it happened in a dream.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you remember anything else about that dream?
Yonagi slowly turns away, her gaze falling down to our shrub.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I feel like I was in a more open place than this city.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There were lots of people living there. There was the sky, and the sea, and the lights shone bright even in the middle of the night. It was really beautiful.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I couldn't go into that city. All I could do was look down at it from behind really thick glass.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I could see my face reflected in the glass, but I couldn't tell if it was really me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And the me I saw there was crying for some reason.
Yonagi stares at the plant by our feet.
She stays like that for a while, her mouth half open.
I patiently wait for her to continue.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I felt like I wanted to be looking out at that view together with someone, but I couldn't remember who.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I kept calling for that person somehow...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's the dream I was having this whole time. I dreamed it for so long.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.
I realize immediately.
That must be it.
It has to be.
The faint memory of herself that interfered with the virtual space.
And inside those tiny remnants, there was Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Now I understand what it meant.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I kept calling for you, and you came for me. Together with Izumo.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Isn't that right?
I give her a small nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thank you for coming for me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wanna see Izumo too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She's waiting at home. She was really excited to greet us with a hot bowl of porridge.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah, she's that happy?
Yonagi giggles at the idea.
I nod, the corners of my mouth twitching into a wry smile.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She looked really happy to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see. Then I'm sure she was.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She's waiting for us.
I extend my hand out to her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
She takes my hand and smiles.
We entwine our fingers and lock our hands together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go home.
She nods and takes one last look at the shrub before we go.
When we return home, we find Izumo hard at work in the kitchen.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo.
Yonagi calls out to her as soon as we enter.
Izumo pauses in what she's doing and turns to face us.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yonagi.
Izumo nods.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm home.
Izumo gives her another small nod, her level stare fixed on Yonagi's face.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Welcome home.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You cleaned the place?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes. Kaito, just what kind of lifestyle were you living in this room?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh...

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Everything was caked in dust, and the floor was covered with flour.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Were you even eating?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah... I was kind of just eating the corn flour as-is.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: On its own?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It kind of has the texture of bread in your mouth. It convenient, and I didn't feel like cooking for just myself...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wow...

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Wait just a moment. I will be finished with the cleaning soon. Then I will prepare a porridge meal.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Your best dish.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Affirmative.
We sit at the table and eat Izumo's porridge together.
Yonagi eats slowly. When she's done, Izumo carefully takes the plate away.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It tasted like home.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, it was delicious.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I'm glad it was to your liking.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Well then.
Yonagi stretches out her arms and takes a deep breath before smiling at me again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There's one thing I need to ask.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?
I feel like a faint shadow falls over her smile all of a sudden.
She rests her hands on the table and casts her gaze down at them.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How long will my memories last?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You two must know about that, right?
I catch a glimpse of Izumo turning around out the corner of my eye.
Izumo stares at Yonagi's back for a moment with a neutral expression.
Then our gazes meet.
I give her a small nod and begin.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How much do you remember from before you went to sleep?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you remember Asuma?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Asuma?
She looks up at me again, and her eyes wander for a moment.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's a person's name, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm, did they mean something to me?
Hearing her calm tone, I realize something.
It could be that her present ego is barely managing to hold together as it is.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Once upon a time, I would have said so. But I don't know how you felt about him towards the end.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Would you tell me everything you know?
I take a deep breath and brace myself.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All right.
I tell her about how my lab was taken from me.
I tell her everything about Asuma. How he was a colleague of her father, and what he did to her.
She slowly blinks at me, listening to my story attentively.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You don't remember any of it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The only people I remember are you and Izumo. And Wooleep too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I must have known everyone, mustn't I? Like the person you mentioned, Iruma? And everyone else in the lab, right?
I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: As far as I heard from Asuma...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He said that your memory regression was at an advanced stage when he decided to forcibly deprive you of your ego.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Though I wouldn't trust anything he says myself.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wonder...
Yonagi trails off, her gaze settling back on her hands.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why can I only remember you two?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I remember you both very well.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why I went there.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Right now your consciousness is being held up by us.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wooleep is continually assisting your brain by using the mapping of the parts of your brain that were stimulated during all the dreams.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That was our plan.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We participated in your dreams. I think that's why—maybe you're reproducing the reactions you had when interacting with us during all those dreams.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Conversely...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The feelings you're experiencing right now...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You could say they're artificial. There is no way for your brain to discern that anymore.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I believe they're real.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're keeping my consciousness in place even now?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Wooleep and I are assisting your brain. Wooleep was originally designed for remote communication, so you can move freely within short distances from him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even with that assistance...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I cannot say for sure how long your brain will hold on.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's enough of a miracle that we got here, to be honest.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Once you hit your limit, you'll lose yourself again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But you two still came for me anyway, didn't you?
I nod in response.
Izumo also gives a small nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo and I made a decision to keep going to the end and never give up on you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: As long as we believe, you will never be truly gone from our hearts.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's why—

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I—
Yonagi murmurs over me.
She slowly brings her gaze back up to meet mine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Am I the same as the old me?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Is the person you wanted to save... the same as the person I am right now?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Of course. You're always you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see...
Yonagi looks down at her own hands again.
She slowly closes her eyes for a moment, then opens them again.
I watch in silence as she does this a few times.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So that's why the city is so calm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I feel like I understand my dream's meaning.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Those people...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's happening to the people that were living inside me now?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They're sleeping.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They're all sleeping behind the panels between the top and middle side.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see...
The silence drags on.
The usually bustling and noisy low side is uncharacteristically quiet.
It somehow makes the silence all the more deafening.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wanna take a walk.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Around the city.
Yonagi turns to Izumo.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can I take a little walk with Kaito?
Izumo gives her a small nod.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Of course.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes?
After letting Yonagi change into her usual clothes, we leave the house.
As we walk alongside the tall corn stalks, Yonagi quietly addresses me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Would you show me places that I should have memories of? Can you tell me about them?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Memories?
Yonagi nods, her eyes still swimming about somewhat randomly.
I peer beyond her bangs and gauge her lethargic expression.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.
She raises her face to look at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You can be honest with me. Do you really not remember anything?
She shakes her head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I do. I remember what happened. Maybe even what I felt at the time.
She slowly blinks at me.
Her gaze wanders as if she's staring at words on a page.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right now...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't really know...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If these feelings of love I have for you are mine or someone else's.
I come to a stop.
Yonagi stops as well, then gently takes my hand with hers.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No, that's not it. I'm sorry.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I just can't see how these feelings I have for you are mine.
She looks down at our hands.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: They don't feel like my own feelings, but like they're someone else's.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Even though I know I love you so much it hurts.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Even though I want to feel at ease when we hold hands like this.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I just can't seem to feel anything of my own right now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sorry.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Don't worry.
I feel my chest tighten with pain.
I promised to accept her, no matter what.
I thought I prepared myself mentally, but my heart feels the pins of reality pushing against it.
I take deep breaths in and out to calm myself.
I guess I'm not as ready as I wanted to think.
She told me that she'd stop being herself.
She asked me if it was okay for her to love me despite it all.
I stepped up to the plate. I said I was ready.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why I want to make those memories mine again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If I don't, I...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I won't be able to love you like you want me to.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll just disappear again without ever giving anything back to you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even so...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even if you did that, it would be okay.
I suppress the anxiety threatening to make my voice break as I speak.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo and I decided it was okay.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We promised to be content.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even if all we did was welcome you home one more time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So—

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I want to answer all that love. I want to do something in return for everything you did.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That feeling is the only one I know to be mine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So please, can you tell me about our memories one more time?
I nod, feeling the warmth on the back of my hand.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Back when we were kids, we used to walk this road together all the time.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Holding hands like this.
I nod, a little smile coming to my lips.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Every day, all the time. Even when we grew up, we always held hands.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Back then, we went to school in the morning, and I went to my technical course to become a researcher while you read in the library.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And in the afternoon, we went to the middle side, had our lunch, then worked until the evening.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You liked doing that. Everyone called it labor, including me, but you always said it was honest work.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah! That does sound like me, yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you remember it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, I do. You were always working so hard to become a researcher.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I didn't have the courage to tell you about my father, and I couldn't even write it down in my stories.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But all the time spent together was so fun for me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I couldn't bring myself to tear it all down. I was too scared to tell you.
I nod at her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was a challenge for me too. Looking back on it, I was so young and clueless.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm sure I'd be much calmer these days. I'd listen to what you have to say without flying off the handle. I certainly wouldn't leave our house over it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We grew up and became adults together, didn't we?
I smile back at her and nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This was pretty much the center of our lives when were kids.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We met here for the first time too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You were making a small car, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The one that was spinning in place.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, you remember well.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You were upset at something the first time we spoke, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wasn't upset, just scared. I didn't go to school, so I never really spoke to anyone besides Mom back then.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, I see.
Yonagi reminiscences about the past with a slight smile on her face.
Asuma was there that day.
Is he also there in the memories she's recalling?
Are her memories clear in her mind? Or rather like watching them through a thick haze?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What were we talking about that day?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: About where our names came from.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You told me that your name means 'calm world', like a lull in the sea.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How about you?
I turn my eyes from the square to look down at her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What does your name mean?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I replied that Mom named me after a kite in the sky, so that I would grow to be a good man who would lift everyone up and take them to where we could all see the sea again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And you said my mother must be a wonderful person.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I was really happy about that. About to cry, actually.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And then we became friends.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
Yonagi slowly overlooks the empty plaza.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wonder if we lived up to our names in the end.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How so?
Yonagi looks up at me and smiles.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And then...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You started going to school too, right?
I nod at her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: My first day here, I didn't imagine I would come to spend most of my time in this building.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The requirements become a researcher were tough. It's one of the few ways lowsiders can become midsiders.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's what I was aiming for, but not even I was confident in actually making it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I was living here until yesterday, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But neither of us were our real selves back then.
Yonagi looks the institute up and down.
I don't know what kind of treatment she got in Asuma lab.
I don't know how long she stayed herself during that time either.
But perhaps it's for the better that she doesn't remember any of what happened after she was kidnapped from our home.
Kaito?
Hearing a familiar voice, I turn around.
Iruma is standing there on the road to the institute.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Kaito! And Yonagi!

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Whoa! It's been ages! How have you been? You look well!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Iruma...
I can't explain how much of a relief it is to see his contagious smile.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I'm so glad to see you. You look so much better now.
I nod and shake his hand.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sorry about what happened back then. No, I should thank you.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Don't sweat it! So you two didn't go, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No.
I suppose he's talking about moving to the virtual space.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Figured. All the Kaito Lab members decided to stay behind.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They did?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Of course! They can go shove it down their throats after they kicked us out like that!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're doing lowsider labor now?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Yeah, I became kind of disillusioned with the whole sider thing ever since our lab got shut down. The good old chief let me help out, and it's not that bad. Pretty fun, actually.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.
Yonagi watches the two of us patiently, but I notice her smile looks somewhat strained.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi, this is a colleague of mine. We used to work together in Kaito Lab. He always supported me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I also told him about your condition when your memory started to regress.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see.
It takes but a moment for Iruma to grasp the situation.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Does she remember you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: That's a relief.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're also planning to just take it easy in the low side too. You can tell everyone. We'd like to see them again.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Sure, you got it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is everyone well?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Good people do good wherever they are. Now they're all thinking about how to share the labor among all the remaining people and how to maintain the city.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: But we're stretched thin just procuring food here underground. Supporting a city with only the corn that we grow in the low side is a full-time job.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: It puzzles me to this day just how in the world the topsiders distributed the food to begin with.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is there sufficient food?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Most houses are empty now, so we're managing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's a relief to hear that. Gives me some hope to know the remaining midsiders and lowsiders are working together.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Gotta say though, nature is terrifying! Leave a patch alone for one day, and you won't be able to fend off the damn weeds!

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: This whole thing opened my eyes. The only reason we were ever able to shut ourselves away in a lab and do research all day was because of the hard work of everyone down in the low side.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're the pride of Kaito Lab. Knowing good people like you and the others are working to keep things running really makes me feel like the lab meant something.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: What are you talking about, crown jewel of the institute? What could be more meaningful than finishing the virtual space? That's nothing compared to us dirtying our hands a little.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You were forced to work at Asuma lab, weren't you, Yonagi? That last session we did, you never woke up from.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Asuma forced you to keep sleeping until they got the data they wanted, didn't he?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: But I'm glad to see you safe and sound now.
Iruma gives Yonagi a broad, sincere smile.
Well...
He doesn't seem to know exactly how the virtual space was eventually completed.
He's one of the few who knew everything about my research.
The fact that he doesn't know means there are probably only a few select people left in the city who do.
Those select few being the members of Asuma Lab.
They hid the fact that they conducted inhumane experiments on Yonagi to fulfill their ends.
Though, thinking about it logically, I suppose that's not surprising.
I'm not sure the migration would have gone so smoothly had people actually known how the virtual space was achieved and maintained.
...Or at least, that's what I want to believe.
Just imagining people rushing without a second thought to a utopia built at the expense of another life ...
I'd rather not believe I worked so hard for so many years for people like that.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You two are still living in the low side, right? Is Izumin waiting for you?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumin?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's what he calls Izumo.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Yeah! Cute, ain't it?
Yonagi gives him a small smile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll try calling her that when we get back.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Nothing would make me happier.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Come hang out soon. Our house is small, but it's got enough space to have a good time.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I'll tell everyone. Sorry for taking so much of your time, guys.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's fine. It's good to see you.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Same here. Everyone was worried you were dead or something.
My smile turns a little bitter at that.
I was pretty much dead at one point, I suppose.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: See you later.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, see you.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Yeah, you bet!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: He's a really lively person, isn't he?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. I could always count on him to give life to the lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He's the opposite of me, pretty much.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But you're good friends.
I nod, feeling a little bit of pride.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We've always been on good terms. Perhaps that's what being friends is like.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's one more place to visit around here.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
Yonagi turns her gaze in the general direction of the researcher residences.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The house in the middle side, right?
I answer with a nod.
That would be...
We often enjoyed each other's intimate company as a married couple.
She'll remember that, I think.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We spent a lot of time there, right?
Though I really can't tell from her expression; it looks like she's just commenting on the weather.
She doesn't seem to feel any shyness about her recollections.
As she is right now, the memories of me and her making love must seem like the distant past memories of a stranger.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's nothing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's get going.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah, this takes me back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
Yonagi sits on the clean bed.
The house in the low side was pretty grimy, but the house here is almost spotless.
It's barely even dusty.
It's clear that the air purification and airtight seal of the building have done their job well.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito.
I turn my eyes away from the almost eerily clean shelves and back to Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you want to make love?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, now? Here?
She nods.
She sits on the edge of the bed, looking straight into my eyes as she asks about our marital activities.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why are you asking me this now?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I mean...
Yonagi casts her gaze down at her lap, the same small smile on her lips.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We were married, and we loved each other...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And you worked so hard to save me, but now that I'm awake...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Isn't it hard for you not to touch me when you have me right in front of you?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm fine with it. I'll do whatever you want, if you want it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sure I'd like to do that, and we used to do it here in the past.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right?
I sit next to her and hold her hand.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You don't need to force yourself to act like the Yonagi in your memories.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If there's anything I could say about you, it's that you were always honest.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Honest?
She tilts her head to the side in confusion.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You always spoke your mind in front of me.
I look down at my hands as I press them together and think.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There was a time when the burden on you to help build the virtual space became too great.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I remember that.
When I raise my face to look at her, I see a smile on her face.
I can't help but smile as well.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Back then, you told me you wanted to stop the experiments. That night, you trusted me with what you couldn't say to anyone else.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I believe that helped us realize something: no matter how significant one's work is, there are times when you need to vent and wish things weren't the way they are.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But in the end, you chose to go back to perform the experiments.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If I had been a better man and stopped the experiments back then, maybe the situation now would be very different.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We could be here all day talking about what could have been.
I chuckle softly.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're right. Anyway...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I may not be proud of much of what I did with my life, but there is one thing I'm certain of.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I feel proud that I became the kind of man you trusted enough to open up your heart to.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So...
I gently take her hand in mine.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do whatever you want to do, as the person you are right now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If you really want to make love with me, I would love to.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But you don't need to offer your body to satisfy me. That's not what this is about.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You don't need to give yourself up to anyone. That's what we worked so hard for, Izumo and I.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: All right.
She gives me a small nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I was a little thoughtless, wasn't I? I'm sorry.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So...
She gently squeezes my hand back.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If I feel the desire without forcing it...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll ask again, okay?
I answer with a nod and a smile.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll be waiting for that.
We walk out of the house, holding hands all the way back down to the low side.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's one more important place.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The place were we rescued Izumo.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: She got dumped in that hole, didn't she?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You did like going there a lot back then.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That place was like a mountain of treasure to us during those days.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I picked up stuff that needed a little repair, then took it to the market to barter for food and soap.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mom really liked the smell of that soap.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You've always been really good at tinkering, yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I guess you could call me the original scrap hunter.
Yonagi smiles at the comment.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's not much else to see there, though. Plus there's another place we should visit before going home.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you wanna do?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'd like to go. That place means a lot to us and Izumo.
I nod at her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All right, let's go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This brings back memories. I haven't been here in years.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It may sound a little obvious, but this place hasn't changed a bit, huh?
She slowly walks through the entrance to the dump.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wonder why Izumo was dumped here.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And who she was living with before that...
Yonagi murmurs as she looks up at a mountain of trash.
She forgot about Shachi.
The boy who climbed the vined walls of that little clearing and danced like a madman on top of the ozone lens, only to meet a sad and sudden end after developing melanoma.
As for Izumo...
I believe Shachi's family must have disposed of her for not fulfilling her role as Shachi's guardian.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Yeah, I wonder about that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You don't know either?
She turns to me, the same placid smile gracing her lips.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Once I had a really bad experience after picking up the trash of a topsider.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ever since, I stopped thinking about the past owners of whatever I picked up.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see.
I lean over a pile of trash and pick up a discarded black object that's caught my eye.
It's a camera from the surface era.
It's different from the one Yonagi had.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even if I were to start repairing stuff again, there would be no one to barter with, huh?
I discard the camera back onto the pile and get up.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's one last place.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think it's the place that has the deepest meaning for you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Soon after we started living together...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We often went to the markets because the rations for two kids' labor weren't enough.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We didn't need cigs or liquor, so we always got paper and ink instead.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sometimes we traded some scraps I'd picked up, or people asked us to repair something.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Back then, I believed that as long as I could make myself useful, everything would work out in the end.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Aren't we going to the market?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Most of the lowsiders migrated, so it's more of an empty square now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The place has changed so much even I find it hard to remember how it used to be.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see... This city is like an empty shell now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, that's one way to put it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's all so quiet. It's not like the low side I know.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I know what you mean.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The last place...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...is where I used to live, right?
I turn my face to her.
She's staring straight forward.
As I watch her profile, she looks up and me and smiles.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Bingo.
Yonagi's old home was in as much of a sad state as ours before Izumo did something about it.
There's a thick film of dust covering the doorknob.
She walks to the center of the room, slowly scanning the space.
The writing desks and the bookshelves full of material left by her father are covered in years worth of dust.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I used to live here.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You were alone here before we started living together.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?
Her eyes widen in surprise.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Alone?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I was a kid?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you remember anything from before we met?
Yonago slowly looks over the room, and her gaze settles on a corkboard.
She walks over to it and looks at the pictures pinned to it.
I move to stand next to her and follow her gaze.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito... Izumo... Wooleep... And that man from before...
She stops at the picture we took the day of Kaito Lab's first research presentation.
She stares intently at the photo for a long while.
Then she slowly turns to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Who are these people?
She asks, pointing to the picture of her father and Asuma.
I let my gaze wander, uncertainty keeping my tongue.
I hesitate, unsure whether to answer with the truth or not.
Abruptly, Yonagi then looks down at the table beside her and picks up a sketchbook.
She stops at a page with a drawing of her birth mother.
She stares at it for a moment, and a smile forms on her face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: She's very beautiful, isn't she?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: They're kinda similar.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Similar?
She looks up at me and nods.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You know, the editor wife from Hatano Rin's story.
A faint shadow is cast over her smile.
Then, she turns to the sketchbook again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If she appeared in that story...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That must mean she was an important person to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But...
She slowly closes the book.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It looks like I can't remember.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That woman...
I make up my mind and steel myself.
Yonagi's world...
It doesn't have to reflect reality. It should be whatever she wants.
Otherwise...
Why did I even bother to bring her back to this empty, blasted hole of a city.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She was your mother.
She look up at me, her eyes wide at the revelation.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The person with long hair in this photo was your father.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And the one next to him was his friend.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Ah, I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All of them...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They were all important to you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They sadly passed away, but you always treasured that photo and the sketchbook.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see. I understand now.
She forgot.
She forgot the trauma that losing her father caused her.
And she forgot about the mother that abandoned her.
It's almost as if...
She has begun to follow the exact same path her father once did.
But she...
It would be so much easier if I could just forget what that woman did.
That's what she once said to me.
And just like she said...
Now she has lost her own pain.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thank you for today.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thanks for showing me so many places.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I finally understand after coming to this room.
Her smile has a desolate tinge to it.
It looks like there's a hint of resignation and sadness behind it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm certain this room was important to me... It must be full to the brim of things I never wanted to forget.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I can't feel a thing.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't feel like I ever lived here.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Now I understand.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm not the person I used to be. She's gone now.
Yonagi reaches out for the polaroid camera resting on a shelf and picks it up.
She slowly traces her fingers along the camera as she stares at it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?
I watch her dazedly.
Yonagi stares vacantly at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You'll still be with me? Despite everything?
I begin, my mind already set.
I gaze into her eyes and continue.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll stay by your side till the end.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's what I decided the moment we woke you up.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I won't leave your side, no matter what.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If you're fine with that, then—
I shake my head at her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think your symptoms may fluctuate depending on the day.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe tomorrow you'll remember what you can't recall today.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's no need to hurry things. You only just woke up.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe I'm really talking to myself, heh. I may have been a little impatient too.
She lets out a little giggle at that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You'll wait until I fall in love with you again?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Of course I will.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm glad you woke me up.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm glad you were the one next to me when I opened my eyes. That's what I feel right now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I also feel myself loving you more and more, little by little...
She says, putting her hands together and looking into my eyes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So give me just a little more time.
I answer with a nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm so glad. You can't imagine how glad I am to hear that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go home. Izumo's waiting.
I extend my hand to her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, let's go.
She puts her hand in mine, and we walk out.
We entwine our fingers together as we walk back.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh?
She widens her eyes and stares down at her own hands.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?
But as I hold her hand, I notice something.
Her hand is neither closed nor open.
It's just kind of limp, like the hand of a sleeping person.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: My fingers...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I can't move them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...How about your toes?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm, I can move them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Good.
Ever since that day...
We start giving Yonagi daily examinations, just like I did with Mom when I was a kid.
Thankfully, the progress of the paralysis doesn't seem to be as rapid as it was with her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How is she?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: There are no anomalies in the data I am monitoring.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm hungry.
Izumo nods and walks to the kitchen.
After a while, the sweet scent of synth milk spreads throughout the house.
After eating the porridge with Izumo's help, Yonagi spends the afternoon reading her own novels.
She keeps reading the same three novels every single day.
Sitting at the desk, she quietly uses her left hand to turn the pages.
We've been home for a whole week without going out.
I feel like she's speaking less as time goes on.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Which one are you reading today?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Rin's story.
I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How do you feel about reading your own novels?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...I guess it feels like I didn't write this myself.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I do remember having these dreams.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's kind of interesting to see all those things I saw in writing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.
She answers my questions the same way every day.
No matter which novel she's reading.
She wrote those novels to try and come closer to her past self, but they're not reaching her right now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: An old friend is coming over today.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Old friend?
I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: One of my colleagues from the lab. They wanna see you.
She murmurs, a faint smile on her face as she looks up at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can't wait.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Hey there!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sorry for taking you away from your work.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Don't sweat it, man! I got way more time on my hands than I ever did back at the lab.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Good day to you, Yonagi!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hello.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: It's been a while, Izumin!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It's good to see you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi, do you recognize him?
She tilts her head slightly.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: He was one of your researcher friends, right?
Iruma and I exchange glances.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Well, it's been a while. Why don't we sit down like the geezers we are and reminiscence about the good old days?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're not that old, are we?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I just want to get ahead of the curve and get it into my head while everyone around me can still say that.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Imagine me realizing I'm old one day while I'm all wrinkly! I'd die from a heart attack!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah.
Yonagi puts a hand over her mouth and laughs at the silly comment.
We both heave an internal sigh of relief.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Her condition is worsening, isn't it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Again, sorry for taking your time for this.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I told you it's fine! Really!

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: What's happening to her, though? Why does she only recognize you and Izumin?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You know about the error in the virtual space?
Iruma nods, his expression turning pensive.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: The thing about everyone in it having the same dreams, right? Yeah, I heard about that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Those dreams... They were the stories from the novels that Yonagi wrote based on her memories with me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think a little fragment of her ego that was left over from what they did to her was calling out to me.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Oh, I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo and I connected into her dreams until we managed to send the signals she subconsciously wanted.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All while we mapped out the parts of her brain that activated and reacted to those signals.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Now we're using that data to continuously assist her brain.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's how we've managed to hold back her memory regression, even if just temporarily.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: So that's how it is. So you pinpointed the areas of her brain that activated when recognizing the two of you.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: That does seem consistent with what I saw back there.
I nod at him and glance back at the house.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I was prepared for this.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I still wonder about what's happening to her fingers, though.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We don't know. It may be the same ailment my mother suffered from.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Or it may be a side effect from the experiments.
After a moment of hesitation, I decide not to tell Iruma about what Asuma did to her brain.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We'll wait and see how it progresses for a little longer. If there are no positive changes, then...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I guess we'll have no choice but to go and ask him about it.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I wonder why...

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Why are you two the only ones subjected to all of this?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I just don't get why you can't be left alone.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thank you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really, it means a lot to know you feel that way.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sorry I couldn't invite everyone today. The house is pretty small, as you saw.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Yeah, reminded me of an expression I read in an old book. What was it? Ah! Cramped as a can of sardines!
We share a little bit of laughter before turning back to the fields.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I'll bring some corn whiskey next time. I'd say it's about time we share some drinks again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa, that brings back memories. You got your hands on some?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: There's more of it than we know what to do with, actually. Everyone who needed it just to get through the day went and moved to the virtual space.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hah, that makes sense.
I watch the fields as the sprinklers come on. The droplets of water look like a shower of amber rain under the light of the setting sun.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll be in touch. Thanks for the help.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Aw, come on now. I am and always will be Kaito Lab's second in command.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And my greatest friend as well.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You look after Yonagi and Izumin well now, eh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You can bet on that.
